provis.utils package

Submodules

provis.utils.atminfo module

provis.utils.atminfo.import_atm_mass_info()

Funtion to load atomic mass from atmmass.csv, to be used in main

Returns

dict - dictionary of atomic mass by atom name

provis.utils.atminfo.import_atm_size_info(vw=0)

Funtion to load atomic radii from atmsize.csv, to be used in main

Parameters

  • name – vw - option to return vanderwaals radius

  • type – bool - returns if true

Returns

dict - dictionary of atomic radius by atom name

Returns

dict - dictionary of color by atom name

Returns

dict - !optional! return dictionary of vw rdius by atom name

provis.utils.bond_parser.bond_parser(filename)

Calculates bond information from mol2 file.

Parameters

  • name – filename - Name of file to open

  • type – str

Returns

dataFrame - Pandas df with bonds

provis.utils.charges_utils module

Utility functions for computing hydrogen bonds and electrostatics on protein surface.

provis.utils.charges_utils.compute_angle_deviation(a: numpy.ndarray, b: numpy.ndarray, c: numpy.ndarray, theta: float) → float

Computes the absolute angle deviation from theta. a, b, c form the three points that define the angle.

a: np.ndarray,

Coordinate vector of the first point

b: np.ndarray,

Coordinate vector of the second point

c: np.ndarray,

Coordinate vector of the third point

theta: float,

Angle to compute deviation with respect to.

(float) absolute deviation of the angle formed by a, b, c with theta

b: np.ndarray,

Coordinate vector of the second point

c: np.ndarray,

Coordinate vector of the third point

provis.utils.charges_utils.normalize_electrostatics(in_elec: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray

Normalizing charges on the surface, by clipping to upper and lower thresholds and converting all values to a -1/1 scale.

in_elec: np.ndarray,

Input charges for all surface vertices

elec: np.ndarray,

Normalized surface vertex charges

provis.utils.name_checker module

provis.utils.name_checker.check_name(name)

Checks if the provided name corresponds to an existing pdb file. Works if “name” points to a pdb file in the working directory or a pdb file in the default pdb file location: provis/data/pdb. Always sets “out_path” to default output location: provis/data/tmp.

Parameters

  • name – name - Name and path to location of the pdb file. If simply pdb id (file name without .pdb extension) is provided the default directory - provis/data/pdb - will be searched for the file. If no file found the input is returned.

  • type – str

Returns

str - path to the input pdb id (file without the extension)

Returns

str - path to the output pdb id - data/tmp/{pdb_id}

provis.utils.surface_utils module

https://github.com/bunnech/holoprot/blob/main/holoprot/utils/surface.py is the base for this file. Modifications were made.

Utilities for preparing and computing features on molecular surfaces.

provis.utils.surface_utils.compute_normal(vertices: numpy.ndarray, faces: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray

Compute normals for the vertices and faces

Parameters

  • name – vertices - Vertices of the mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – faces - Faces of the mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

Returns

np.ndarray - Normals of the mesh

provis.utils.surface_utils.crossp(x: numpy.ndarray, y: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray

Creates the cross product of two numpy arrays

Parameters

  • name – x - Array 1

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – y - Array 2

  • type – np.ndarray

Returns

np.ndarray - (Array 1) x (Array 2)

provis.utils.surface_utils.fix_trimesh(mesh, resolution: float = 1.0)

Applies a predefined set of fixes to the mesh, and converts it to a specified resolution. These fixes include removing duplicated vertices wihin a certain threshold, removing degenerate triangles, splitting longer edges to a given target length, and collapsing shorter edges.

Parameters

  • name – mesh - Mesh

  • type – trimesh.Trimesh

  • name – resolution - Maximum size of edge in the mesh

  • tyoe – float

Returns

trimesh.Trimesh - mesh with all fixes applied

provis.utils.surface_utils.get_surface(out_path: str, density: float = 0.5, remove_files: bool = True)

Wrapper function that reads in the output from the MSMS executable to build the protein surface.

Parameters

  • name – out_path - path to output (output path from namechecker) directory. Usually data/tmp

  • type – str

  • name – remove_files - Whether to remove the intermediate output files. Default: True.

  • type – bool

provis.utils.surface_utils.output_pdb_as_xyzrn(pdb_file: str, xyzrn_file: str) → None

Converts a .pdb file to a .xyzrn file.

Parameters

  • name – pdb_file - path to PDB File to convert (with extension)

  • type – str

  • name – xyzrn_file - path to the xyzrn File (with extension)

  • type – str

provis.utils.surface_utils.prepare_trimesh(vertices: numpy.ndarray, faces: numpy.ndarray, normals: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, resolution: float = 1.0, apply_fixes: bool = False)

Prepare the mesh surface given vertices and faces. Optionally, compute normals and apply fixes to mesh.

Parameters

  • name – vertices - Surface vertices

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – faces - Triangular faces on the mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – normals - Normals for each vertex

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – apply_fixes - Optional application of fixes to mesh. Check fix_mesh for details on fixes. Default: False,

  • type – bool

Returns

trimesh.Trimesh - Mesh
